title: How does Victor Wooten do THIS??

🎸 The Slap Accelerator is now OPEN for enrollment! Claim your spot before it closes to get your $100 discount + FREE bonuses → https://sbl.link/3IQanpq

🔥 Try the SBL Bass Academy FREE for 14 Days: https://sbl.link/join-sbl
🚀 Get 1-1 Bass Coaching (12 Month Mentorship Program): https://sbl.link/the-blueprint

===

Double thumb used to be my worst nightmare—until Ian dropped a course that made it look way too fun to ignore. In this video, I break down how I finally got it together, plus a slap riff to help you do the same. If you’ve ever struggled with this technique, you’re in good company!

===

12:00 - My Slap Bass Journey
12:40 - Final Thoughts

caption: False
title: Is this the Greatest PUNK-SOUL Bass Line of 1982?
description:
👉 Grab the FREE Tab & Notation here: https://sbl.link/3IXdw6V
🔥 Try the SBL Bass Academy FREE for 14 Days: https://sbl.link/join-sbl
🚀 Get 1-1 Bass Coaching (12 Month Mentorship Program): https://sbl.link/the-blueprint

Punk meets Motown? In this lesson, Ian breaks down A Town Called Malice by The Jam—a bass line that’s all feel, motion, and attitude. From the jumpy, soul-inspired groove to the driving verse, there’s a lot going on under the hood. 

You’ll hear the Motown influence - but played like it’s late for a train.
Grab your bass and dig in—this one’s all about getting it in your hands and feeling it for yourself.

===

Video Breakdown:

00:00 - Introduction
00:44 - Motown Inspiration
01:22 - Intro & Chorus Riff
02:58 - Gear & Sound
06:38 - Picking Technique
08:30 - Verse
10:26 - How To Master The Feel
11:00 - Pick Technique Continued
12:40 - Wrap Up
13:05 - Outtakes

===

title: Is this the Greatest PUNK-SOUL Bass Line of 1982?
description:
👉 Grab the FREE Tab & Notation here: https://sbl.link/3IXdw6V
🔥 Try the SBL Bass Academy FREE for 14 Days: https://sbl.link/join-sbl
🚀 Get 1-1 Bass Coaching (12 Month Mentorship Program): https://sbl.link/the-blueprint

Punk meets Motown? In this lesson, Ian breaks down A Town Called Malice by The Jam—a bass line that’s all feel, motion, and attitude. From the jumpy, soul-inspired groove to the driving verse, there’s a lot going on under the hood. 

You’ll hear the Motown influence - but played like it’s late for a train.
Grab your bass and dig in—this one’s all about getting it in your hands and feeling it for yourself.

===

13:05 - Outtakes

title: Is this the Greatest PUNK-SOUL Bass Line of 1982?
description:
👉 Grab the FREE Tab & Notation here: https://sbl.link/3IXdw6V
🔥 Try the SBL Bass Academy FREE for 14 Days: https://sbl.link/join-sbl
🚀 Get 1-1 Bass Coaching (12 Month Mentorship Program): https://sbl.link/the-blueprint

Punk meets Motown? In this lesson, Ian breaks down A Town Called Malice by The Jam—a bass line that’s all feel, motion, and attitude. From the jumpy, soul-inspired groove to the driving verse, there’s a lot going on under the hood. 

You’ll hear the Motown influence - but played like it’s late for a train.
Grab your bass and dig in—this one’s all about getting it in your hands and feeling it for yourself.

===

13:05 - Outtakes

Punk meets Motown? In this lesson, Ian breaks down A Town Called Malice by The Jam—a bass line that’s all feel, motion, and attitude. From the jumpy, soul-inspired groove to the driving verse, there’s a lot going on under the hood. 

You’ll hear the Motown influence - but played like it’s late for a train.
Grab your bass and dig in—this one’s all about getting it in your hands and feeling it for yourself.

title: How does Victor Wooten do THIS??

description:

Punk meets Motown? In this lesson, Ian breaks down A Town Called Malice by The Jam—a bass line that’s all feel, motion, and attitude. From the jumpy, soul-inspired groove to the driving verse, there’s a lot going on under the hood. 

You’ll hear the Motown influence - but played like it’s late for a train.
Grab your bass and dig in—this one’s all about getting it in your hands and feeling it for yourself.

title: Is this the Greatest PUNK-SOUL Bass Line of 1982?
description:
👉 Grab the FREE Tab & Notation here: https://sbl.link/3IXdw6V
🔥 Try the SBL Bass Academy FREE for 14 Days: https://sbl.link/join-sbl
🚀 Get 1-1 Bass Coaching (12 Month Mentorship Program): https://sbl.link/the-blueprint

Punk meets Motown? In this lesson, Ian breaks down A Town Called Malice by The Jam—a bass line that’s all feel, motion, and attitude. From the jumpy, soul-inspired groove to the driving verse, there’s a lot going on under the hood. 

You’ll hear the Motown influence - but played like it’s late for a train.
Grab your bass and dig in—this one’s all about getting it in your hands and feeling it for yourself.

===

06:38 - Picking Technique
08:30 - Verse
10:26 - How To Master The Feel
11:00 - Pick Technique Continued
12:40 - Wrap Up
13:05 - Outtakes

===

description:

🔥 Try the SBL Bass Academy FREE for 14 Days: https://sbl.link/join-sbl
🚀 Get 1-1 Bass Coaching (12 Month Mentorship Program): https://sbl.link/the-blueprint

Punk meets Motown? In this lesson, Ian breaks down A Town Called Malice by The Jam—a bass line that’s all feel, motion, and attitude. From the jumpy, soul-inspired groove to the driving verse, there’s a lot going on under the hood. 

You’ll hear the Motown influence - but played like it’s late for a train.
Grab your bass and dig in—this one’s all about getting it in your hands and feeling it for yourself.

===

08:30 - Verse

11:00 - Pick Technique Continued

13:05 - Outtakes

caption: False
title: Is this the Greatest PUNK-SOUL Bass Line of 1982?
description:
👉 Grab the FREE Tab & Notation here: https://sbl.link/3IXdw6V
🔥 Try the SBL Bass Academy FREE for 14 Days: https://sbl.link/join-sbl
🚀 Get 1-1 Bass Coaching (12 Month Mentorship Program): https://sbl.link/the-blueprint

Punk meets Motown? In this lesson, Ian breaks down A Town Called Malice by The Jam—a bass line that’s all feel, motion, and attitude. From the jumpy, soul-inspired groove to the driving verse, there’s a lot going on under the hood. 

You’ll hear the Motown influence - but played like it’s late for a train.
Grab your bass and dig in—this one’s all about getting it in your hands and feeling it for yourself.

===

Video Breakdown:

00:00 - Introduction
00:44 - Motown Inspiration
01:22 - Intro & Chorus Riff
02:58 - Gear & Sound
06:38 - Picking Technique
08:30 - Verse
10:26 - How To Master The Feel
11:00 - Pick Technique Continued
12:40 - Wrap Up
13:05 - Outtakes

===

title: How does Victor Wooten do THIS??

caption: false
title: Is this the Greatest PUNK-SOUL Bass Line of 1982?
description:
👉 Grab the FREE Tab & Notation here: https://sbl.link/3IXdw6V
🔥 Try the SBL Bass Academy FREE for 14 Days: https://sbl.link/join-sbl
🚀 Get 1-1 Bass Coaching (12 Month Mentorship Program): https://sbl.link/the-blueprint

Punk meets Motown? In this lesson, Ian breaks down A Town Called Malice by The Jam—a bass line that’s all feel, motion, and attitude. From the jumpy, soul-inspired groove to the driving verse, there’s a lot going on under the hood. 

You’ll hear the Motown influence - but played like it’s late for a train.
Grab your bass and dig in—this one’s all about getting it in your hands and feeling it for yourself.

===

Video Breakdown:

00:00 - Introduction
00:44 - Motown Inspiration
01:22 - Intro & Chorus Riff
02:58 - Gear & Sound
06:38 - Picking Technique
08:30 - Verse
10:26 - How To Master The Feel
11:00 - Pick Technique Continued
12:40 - Wrap Up
13:05 - Outtakes

===
